messages.message: For visibility I’ll post this here. But we have been working on a mobile version of AIHub Converse. It is available on the sandbox (https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/) and just visit the site on your phone to view it. I didn’t have time to get a physical Android phone to test this on so I’m interested in some feedback regarding it’s use on Android (and iOS as well). We are targeting the release for 23.41 and just polishing it up.

Ill provide feedback within this post. The closing of the yellow bar to go back to the question section is not user intuative and i stumbled upon it. Maybe the yellow bar indicates go to questions or go to document
Also my first click to get back to home would be on the top level icon which is not clickable. Seems no way to get back to the main home page from any icon

Thanks for the feedback, @joshbronko!
1. We will look to make the interaction more intuitive to go back to the chatlog. We also take user back to chat log when they ask a new prompt. 
2. We are adding a way to go back to the home page! Thanks for pointing it out.
When using my iPhone and taking a photo I set the name of the photo then it comes back with no data. Seems it’s still processing then appears
Also upon second photo upload, we keep the name of file the same, could we consider setting that back to blank?
thanks @joshbronko, all of those things you’re pointing out are WIP
though the file name thing is a new one to me and I will get that handled
the yellow bar toggle to DocWidget is going to look very different by end of today, and the Chat input box will also be getting model options and “clear chat” buttons as well.
Also is there a setting button for setting checkboxes and long table extraction on mobile?
we do not have those on there right now. Though I am working on a settings page today and can see if I can get those added.
it is possible they might not make the MVP cut

I know this may be a personal preference but when you click on the ask bar, it doesnt keep the top bar static and just shifts it to the top. I think it would be helpful to still see the top bar with the information to bounce between last questions and the document. It also forces it to the text box upon entering a conversation which i prefer but if you forget theres a top bar there you may not scroll
Pre populating the update name should be considered
@Liam Callanan ^^^
Pre-populating is on backlog (cc:@Xindi Xu). We should get this in for next release as a quick UI improvement.
wow it looks amazing!!
Yea, pre-populating the name should be merged in already :slightly_smiling_face:
pre populating the name in this case would be specific to the mobile design I believe. @Liam Callanan is on that page and we’ll see what we can do
It’s a quick fix, I’ll have the merged in soon
I'm happy to do any testing needed on Android. I did open and did a quick prompt on the demo document and it all looked great.
@ChrisM test file/camera uploads as much as you can pleas
